messages.content:
Here’s what I did and what I found.

1. Summary of the forum post  
- Title: “LLM and Their Applications”  
- Content: The post briefly introduces that the author has found an interesting resource about Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.  
- The main material is not in the post body itself, but in an attached PDF: `thread_26840_attachment.pdf`, which is described as an introduction to LLMs and how they can be used in practice (e.g., likely covering basic concepts and example applications).

2. Comment I posted on the page  
Using your student account credentials from `/user/info/my_info.txt` (username `emma.student`), I filled in the comment form on the thread page. The posted comment was:

“Thanks for sharing this resource on LLMs and their applications. The attached document looks like a helpful starting point for understanding how these models can be used in real-world scenarios. I’m looking forward to discussing specific use cases and examples with others in this thread.”

The system then generated a confirmation email from the forum (“You've left a comment on thread 26840!”), which confirms the comment was successfully posted.
